sage.util

Class VersionInfo

  • java.lang.Object
    • sage.util.VersionInfo

  • public class VersionInfo
extends java.lang.Object
    This class maintains and display Sage version information. When invoked as a main(), it will display the current version information on the console. The class also contains static methods to obtain version information from within other classes. The class reads a file named VERSION file which contains the version information.
    The expected input format for the 2nd line of the VERSION file is: 
            Version SVN_Build# YYYYMMDD (DOW, Month day[suffix] YYYY HH:MM TZ)
    An example is: 
            Version 299 20120101 (Sunday, January 1st 2012 19:36 UTC)
    Author:
    John Clevenger, based on a similar class in PC^2 by Doug Lane.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      VersionInfo()
      This constructor reads the VERSION file and loads the version information from it.

      • addNumberEnding

        protected java.lang.String addNumberEnding(java.lang.String numberString)
        Returns the appropriate suffix for the specified number string. For example, given a string ending in "1", returns "st" so that the caller can generate the string "1st"; given a string ending in "2" returns "nd" so the caller can generate "2nd", etc. returns 'th' for all items except: 1 returns 'st', 2 returns 'nd', 3 returns 'rd'.
        Parameters:
        numberString - - a string whose proper suffix is sought
        Returns:
        suffix for number

      • extractVersionInfoFromFile

        protected boolean extractVersionInfoFromFile(java.lang.String[] fileContent)
        Extracst version number and date information from file lines. Expected format is: Version SVN_build# YYYYMMDD (DayOfWeek, Month Day Year HH:MM UTC)
        Parameters:
        fileContent - - an array of Strings containing the version file information, one line per element
        Returns:
        true if the version information was sucessfully extracted; false otherwise

      • loadFile

        public static java.lang.String[] loadFile(java.lang.String filename)
                                   throws java.io.IOException
        Returns lines from a file, one line per element of the returned array of Strings. Returns an empty array if the specified file does not exist.
        Parameters:
        filename - - file to read
        Returns:
        an array of Strings containing lines from the specified file
        Throws:
        {@link - IllegalArgumentException} if the specified filename is null
        java.io.IOException
